revised_title: Percy Faraday Frankland: A Life in Science and Bacteriology
tldr: Percy Faraday Frankland was a prominent chemist and bacteriologist who made significant contributions to the fields of water analysis, stereochemistry, and the history of science. He was a pioneer in bacteriology and played a crucial role in the systematic examination of London's water supplies. Frankland also collaborated with his wife on various research projects and authored several books and publications throughout his career.
